Package de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.strategies.eclipse.xml

Class ConfigReader

java.lang.Object
de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.strategies.eclipse.xml.ConfigReader
public class ConfigReader
extends java.lang.Object
This class reads a config file for Eclipse code formatter.
Author:
jecki, Matt Blanchette, bahlef

    • toFileObject

      public static org.openide.filesystems.FileObject toFileObject​(java.lang.String filePath) throws java.io.IOException
      Creates a FileObject from the given filePath and returns it.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to a file which should be turned into a FileObject
      Returns:
      a FileObject representing the given filePath
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is an I/O issue while trying to access the given filePath

    • toFileObject

    • getProfileSettings

      @NotNull public static @NotNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getProfileSettings​(org.openide.filesystems.FileObject fileObject, java.lang.String profileName) throws ConfigReadException, ProfileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException, org.xml.sax.SAXException
      Parses and returns the key/value pairs from the given FileObject for the given profileName as a Map.
      Parameters:
      fileObject - the FileObject to parse
      profileName - the profile name for which to get the settings
      Returns:
      a Map within all the configuration paramters of the given profileName read from the given FileObject, or throws an exception if there's a problem reading the input, e.g.: invalid XML.
      Throws:
      org.xml.sax.SAXException - if there are parsing issues
      java.io.IOException - if there is an I/O issue
      ConfigReadException - if the given FileObject is not a valid Eclipse formatter template
      ProfileNotFoundException - if no profile could be found with the given profileName in the given FileObject

    • getProfileNames

      @NotNull public static @NotNull java.util.List<java.lang.String> getProfileNames​(org.openide.filesystems.FileObject fileObject) throws ConfigReadException, java.io.IOException, org.xml.sax.SAXException
      Parses the given FileObject and returns a List within all profile names found in that FileObject.
      Parameters:
      fileObject - the FileObject to parse
      Returns:
      a List within all profile names found in the given FileObject
      Throws:
      org.xml.sax.SAXException - if there are parsing issues
      java.io.IOException - if there is an I/O issue
      ConfigReadException - if the given FileObject is not a valid Eclipse formatter template
